instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Touchbar
threads.message:
Customer spilt pot noddle over keyboard. Mac would not power on. Cleaned out keyboard and removed logic board. Area around UT890, CT701 and LT700 corroded. The via under pin 1 of LT700 had completly gone so ran a wire from pin 2 <SIGNAL>PP5V_S2_DFR_FILT</SIGNAL> to CX401 Pin 1 ( I did not replace LT700)

After that repair the MacBook worked fine along with keyboard and trackpad, the only thing that did not work was the Touchbar.
Ultrasoniced that small area (not the whole board) and after that the MacBook still comes on and chimes but no backlight, keyboard or trackpad.

If I plug in a usb mouse and keyboard and click on a key or mouse button then the backlight will come on for about 3 seconds then go out again. Also if I breifly press the power button whilst the Mac is on the backlight again will come on for a couple of seconds and then go off again.


Any help appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Touchbar
threads.message:
Something happened in the ultrasonic process.
Probably some (already) corroded components dropped from MLB; or broken traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Touchbar
threads.message: On this model, can the trackpad work without the keyboard plugged in? Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Touchbar
threads.message:
TP works alone.
Viceversa not valid; KB needs TP connected.
